alert.note: Alert for Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 4:50PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Henry, northwestern Clay and Quitman Counties through 630 PM EDT/530 PM CDT/... At 550 PM EDT/450 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Eufaula, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, Days Crossroads, Wire Bridge, Bonapartes Retreat, Standleys Store, Watson Crossroads, Double Bridges, Moores Crossroads, Crossroads, Ricks Place, Garnersville, Coates, Bagby State Park, Thomas Mill Creek, Hatcher, Morris, Cotton Hill and Scottsboro Crossroads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
